discussion.title: Various installation issues
discussion.body:
I had been struggling to get PySR working in most environments but was successful in running the Google Colab tutorial. I was hoping to migrate the functionality of the first block of code out of Google Colab into a python or .pytoml file in order to run PySR outside of the Google Colab environment. However I have been struggling understand what the block of code does to make PySR work.

```sh
!echo "Runtime started."

%%shell
set -e

#---------------------------------------------------#
JULIA_VERSION="1.7.2"
JULIA_NUM_THREADS=4
export JULIA_PKG_PRECOMPILE_AUTO=0
#---------------------------------------------------#

if [ -z `which julia` ]; then
  # Install Julia
  JULIA_VER=`cut -d '.' -f -2 <<< "$JULIA_VERSION"`
  echo "Installing Julia $JULIA_VERSION on the current Colab Runtime..."
  BASE_URL="https://julialang-s3.julialang.org/bin/linux/x64"
  URL="$BASE_URL/$JULIA_VER/julia-$JULIA_VERSION-linux-x86_64.tar.gz"
  wget -nv $URL -O /tmp/julia.tar.gz # -nv means "not verbose"
  tar -x -f /tmp/julia.tar.gz -C /usr/local --strip-components 1
  rm /tmp/julia.tar.gz

  echo "Installing PyCall.jl..."
  julia -e 'using Pkg; Pkg.add("PyCall"); Pkg.build("PyCall")'
  julia -e 'println("Success")'

fi
```
Doing this Google Colab specific task was also necessary:
" Use fallback runtime. Run the above cell (!echo "Runtime started.") to start the runtime. Now, open the command pallette (bottom left -> second icon from the bottom), and search for "use fallback runtime", and hit enter. "

nodes.body:
This block of code is colab-specific. It installs Julia within Google Colab, because their VM (based on Ubuntu) doesn't include Julia by default. Note that Google Colab runs in the cloud, rather than on your local machine â€“ so even if Julia is installed locally, it still needs to be installed on the colab VM.

> Doing this Google Colab specific task was also necessary:
> " Use fallback runtime. Run the above cell (!echo "Runtime started.") to start the runtime. Now, open the command pallette (bottom left -> second icon from the bottom), and search for "use fallback runtime", and hit enter. "

This actually changed only 2 hours ago! See https://github.com/googlecolab/colabtools/issues/3385. I need to update the colab notebook to remove that part, as you have noted ðŸ™‚ 

> I had been struggling to get PySR working in most environments but was successful in running the Google Colab tutorial. 

Please share where you are struggling and I can try to help

---

Edit: updated the notebook.
